alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 3:14AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow ending, with a continued period of extremely dangerous wind chills. Additional accumulations generally less than one inch. Wind chills as low as 35 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon County including Baggs, Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Saratoga, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Winter Storm Warning ends at 11 AM MST this morning. Wind Chill Warning from 5 PM MST today until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be dangerous due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Extremely dangerous wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in 5 minutes or less. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of light snow is possible late Tuesday night through Wednesday. Additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches will be possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
